author: TEDx Talks
description:
What if changing how people see you wasn’t about changing yourself but about changing the moment? Laura Huang reveals how small moments of “delight” can flip perceptions, disrupt biases, and open doors to opportunity. Using her research in behavioral science, she shows how anyone can turn adversity into advantage and create an edge. 

Laura Huang is a professor at Northeastern University and a leading expert on how perception and interpersonal dynamics shape success in entrepreneurship and leadership. Her research explores how individuals can create an edge—even in the face of disadvantage—by turning adversity into advantage and shaping how others see their value. 

This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: How to make a good first impression | Laura Huang | TEDxJeffersonU
